body_html: @mrry, it looks like we pass to TF_LoadLibrary C api which takes char*, so maybe if we get it utf-8 in python and then at the very last moment in windows/env.cc convert it to a LPWSTR with MultiByteToWideChar and use LoadLibraryExW instead of LoadLibraryEx it might not be terrible to get this working.
body_text: @mrry, it looks like we pass to TF_LoadLibrary C api which takes char*, so maybe if we get it utf-8 in python and then at the very last moment in windows/env.cc  convert it to a LPWSTR with MultiByteToWideChar and use LoadLibraryExW instead of LoadLibraryEx it might not be terrible to get this working.
body: @mrry, it looks like we pass to TF_LoadLibrary C api which takes char*, so maybe if we get it utf-8 in python and then at the very last moment in windows/env.cc  convert it to a `LPWSTR` with `MultiByteToWideChar` and use `LoadLibraryExW` instead of `LoadLibraryEx` it might not be terrible to get this working.
